fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder

Class SenderNumberFormatBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.AbstractParent<SenderNumberBuilder>
      • fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.SenderNumberFormatBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<PhoneNumberTranslator>, Parent<SenderNumberBuilder>

    public class SenderNumberFormatBuilder
extends AbstractParent<SenderNumberBuilder>
implements Builder<PhoneNumberTranslator>
    Defines which standard conversions may be applied on the phone number to convert it from a PhoneNumber to an AddressedPhoneNumber.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Constructor Detail

      • SenderNumberFormatBuilder

        public SenderNumberFormatBuilder(SenderNumberBuilder parent,
                                 EnvironmentBuilder<?> environmentBuilder)
        Initializes the builder with a parent builder. The parent builder is used when calling AbstractParent.and() method. The EnvironmentBuilder is used to evaluate properties when build() method is called.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent builder
        environmentBuilder - the configuration for property resolution and evaluation

    • Method Detail

      • alphanumericCode

        public SenderNumberFormatBuilder alphanumericCode(String... properties)
        Enable/disable alphanumeric code conversion: if the sender address is alphanumeric (contains both letters and numbers) or non-numeric, TON is set to 5 and NPI to 0. You can specify one or several property keys. For example: 
         .charset("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        properties - one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • alphanumericCode

        public SenderNumberFormatBuilder alphanumericCode(boolean enable)
        Enable/disable alphanumeric code conversion: if the sender address is alphanumeric (contains both letters and numbers) or non-numeric, TON is set to 5 and NPI to 0.
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable the conversion, false to disable
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • shortCode

        public SenderNumberFormatBuilder shortCode(String... properties)
        Enable/disable short code conversion: if the sender address is a short code, TON is set to 3, and NPI is set to 0. A number is considered to be a short code if the length of the number is 5 digits or less. You can specify one or several property keys. For example: 
         .charset("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        properties - one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • shortCode

        public SenderNumberFormatBuilder shortCode(boolean enable)
        Enable/disable short code conversion: if the sender address is a short code, TON is set to 3, and NPI is set to 0. A number is considered to be a short code if the length of the number is 5 digits or less.
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable the conversion, false to disable
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • internationalNumber

        public SenderNumberFormatBuilder internationalNumber(String... properties)
        Enable/disable international number conversion: if the sender starts with a "+", TON is set to 1, and NPI is set to 1. You can specify one or several property keys. For example: 
         .charset("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        properties - one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • internationalNumber

        public SenderNumberFormatBuilder internationalNumber(boolean enable)
        Enable/disable international number conversion: if the sender starts with a "+", TON is set to 1, and NPI is set to 1.
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable the conversion, false to disable
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
